baseline_groups.claim_summary: Larger groups coordinate worse than smaller groups in the bank-run game, leading to higher withdrawal (bank run) rates.
baseline_groups.notes: Logit regression of withdraw on large (binary: 1=large group 80-90, 0=small group 10) with full controls (rhoValue_high, pastDecision, pastGroupRunning, rValueF, leeftijd, female), using Period 8 data and all treatments except treatment 7. N=1178. Coefficient=0.507, SE=0.196, p=0.010. Clustered by groep_ID.

global_notes: 69 total specifications. 45 are core tests of the group-size claim (controls, sample, inference, method, FE, and functional form variations). 24 are non-core: 5 placebo tests (training periods and permuted treatments), 13 heterogeneity/interaction specs (conditional main effects not comparable to unconditional baseline), and 6 alternative-treatment specs (pastDecision within single treatments, testing a different hypothesis). The paper Table 4 columns 2-3 and 5 include interaction terms that change the estimand of the large coefficient, making them non-comparable to the baseline.
